channel.title: Bunch of random, yet related, questions
channel.description:
i have some little problems with my client, but they kinda bug the crap out of me so i need some help and i have lots of questions.
[s]1. my client cache is messed up, where can i get new cache? (im using Galkon base)[/s]
[s]2. will replacing the client cache fix all the messed up npcs, etc.. permanently? or will i have to fix some code as well to prevent it from happening again?[/s]
3.(not sure if this is server side or not but..) When i use my custom weapons, they appear to be fine but when i fight, it will disappear for a brief second (it disappears when my guy does the attack animation and reappears after)how do i fix this?
And i think thats all for now

item.title: Bunch of random, yet related, questions
item.dc:creator: @Reisyukaku Reisyukaku
item.description:
@Reisyukaku wrote:

im not quite sure what im looking for… i found a bunch of crap for specials, but thats it… can you give me an example or something

Read full topic
item.source: Bunch of random, yet related, questions

item.title: Bunch of random, yet related, questions
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“Reisyukaku, post:1, topic:291752”]i have some little problems with my client, but they kinda bug the crap out of me so i need some help and i have lots of questions.

1. my client cache is messed up, where can i get new cache? (im using Galkon base)

2. will replacing the client cache fix all the messed up npcs, etc… permanently? or will i have to fix some code as well to prevent it from happening again?

3.(not sure if this is server side or not but…) When i use my custom weapons, they appear to be fine but when i fight, it will disappear for a brief second (it disappears when my guy does the attack animation and reappears after)how do i fix this?

And i think thats all for now[/quote]

For the weapon part…Yes, this is server sided. You need to add the fighting animation for the weapon. Search for other weapon ID’s in your client class and you’ll find them. Then just add your weapon with the fighting animation you want.

Read full topic
item.source: Bunch of random, yet related, questions

item.title: Bunch of random, yet related, questions
item.dc:creator: @Reisyukaku Reisyukaku
item.description:
@Reisyukaku wrote:

W00000000000000000T… I FIX’D IT.

…cuz who ever had it last didnt follow this simple rule

How To Make Ints. Stop blaming your ints, it's your models

When renaming models when putting them into your models folder, they must be renamed between 8000 - 15000, if not, then your cache may become broken, and simple models such as chickens, may be overwritten by the armadyl godsword special gfx.

Thanks for all your help guys.

But… there are still 1 more un-answered question at the top ;D
lol… jk

Read full topic
item.source: Bunch of random, yet related, questions

item.title: Bunch of random, yet related, questions
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

  1. my client cache is messed up, where can i get new cache? (im using Galkon base)
    if RSMV didnt have slight problems i would say just replace the items in the models folder, since galkon uses a 317 the first 30k models should do the trick, but im not sure it handles .dat format.

  2. will replacing the client cache fix all the messed up npcs, etc… permanently? or will i have to fix some code as well to prevent it from happening again?
    it should, as long as you dont put ANY models into the models folder, if it has one.

3.(not sure if this is server side or not but…) When i use my custom weapons, they appear to be fine but when i fight, it will disappear for a brief second (it disappears when my guy does the attack animation and reappears after)how do i fix this?
yes this is a server sided thing. It means you did not tell the server what attack animation to use.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 29, 2009, 10:44:53 pm[/size][hr][quote=“Reisyukaku, post:7, topic:291752”]
the center of varock still looks like this… …do you think there is a bad code or something that is breaking the cache… cuz i know that adding models with a number > 1500 can do that, and thats why i took them out.[/quote]
Small answer to this. This is a cache problem, just a replaced peice of fence. I fixed my cache about 90% of the way so far, just try to figure out what ID those models load as, and go into RSMV and find the corresponding model to that ID, gzip it, and it should fix it after adding the new models.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Reisyukaku Reisyukaku
item.description:
@Reisyukaku wrote:

zyle1992:

Clearly it’s not, because my Varrock square looks just fine with that cache. Change your client.

well thats why i kept saying it must be a coding problem somewhere. Btw, ive come to the conclusion that it is a 100% client side problem because silab client worked fine… only problem is it seems like no one here knows what causes the cache to break like that… so its gonna be a little difficult to fix… i dont wanna download another client because it would be a bitch to transfer or all the code and models i made.

Read full topic

item.description:

Hexyl:

download a 317 deob, and make your own client. there simple.

well first off, whats deob mean. secondly, i just tryed that and there is nowhere to put my models

zyle1992:

Actually, that’s not the client i posted. Those models are from the GWD. This was a clean cache, and minelooks fine. Make sure your cache is in the right dir.

I used the cache from the client… the client its self woulndt work cuz someone took out all the .java files so i coulnt change the ip.
